intro: Humularia bakeriana, commonly known as the Baker's humularia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which are adapted to its cool, moist environments. Its flowers are typically pale green to yellowish, with five petals and a prominent central column. Humularia bakeriana is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
